item.title: Episode 43: This Week In Tech (August 09, 2021)
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.itunes:subtitle: Like always we are also bringing you out tech this week episode with different tech events that took place the previous week. Starting with Apple’s plan to scan US phones for child abuse photos, the new Google Pixel 6, Mozilla firefox losing 46 Mil
item.itunes:summary:
Like always we are also bringing you out tech this week episode with different tech events that took place the previous week. Starting with Apple’s plan to scan US phones for child abuse photos, the new Google Pixel 6, Mozilla firefox losing 46 Million users in the last three weeks, how many people are losing their cryptocurrency wallet passwords & more.
Episode Timeline
00:19 Apple to scan US IOS user’s for child abuse photos.
01:34 Security companies fear Apple’s photo scan might be a privacy compromise for users.
03:26 A recent cryptocurrency study shows that 40% of crypto owners have lost their passwords at a certain time.
07:10 Google Pixel 6 announced the past week, with its own Tensor Chip
11:11 Google fired employees for inappropriate use of user data
13:52 Firefox lost about 46 Million users the past three years
Contact the hosts
Henok Tsegaye Twitter Instagram LinkedIn
Abdulhadmid Oumer Twitter Instagram linkedIn
Follow Zemach FM and give us comment

item.itunes:author: Zemach FM

item.title: Ethics In Artificial Intelligence: With Dr. Timnit Gebru
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 43rd Episode of Zemach FM, We bring you Dr. Timnit Gebru to discuss about Ethics in Artificial intelligence. Even though our main focus was some of the Ethics issues in artificial intelligence, we also tried to discuss in-depth about Dr. Timnit’s career journey, the good and bad side of AI models being implemented by big tech companies these days, what some of the details of there paper about Stochastic parrots was all about and much more.

Episode Timeline

01:22 Introduction to our guest and episode title.

02:44 Timnit Gebru’s career journey introduction

07:12 What Timnit Gebru thinks about AI takeover

09:29 How was your stay at Microsoft and Apple?

16:00 How would you inform people with no knowledge about the dangers of ethical problems in AI?

21:33 The problems of content control using Artificial intelligence

23:30 What are some of the contents of “On the dangers of Stochastic Parrots”

31:40 What are some of the solutions for the common problems in Artificial intelligence.

34:50 Why is low attention given to software services being provided to Africa

36:50 How was Black In AI started and what are some of the jobs being done there.

41:40 Why was Dr. Timnit Gebru fired from Google.

45:50 What is Dr. Timnit focusing on these days.

46:50 Is making tech research important for Ethiopia and Africa as a whole?

50:00 Dr. Timit’s advice to people getting into Artificial Intelligence

52:30 What is your plan for the institute you are planning to open?

Links In The Episode

Black In AI

Fast AI

Addis Coder

Contact the hosts

Henok Tsegaye Twitter Instagram LinkedIn

Abdulhadmid Oumer Twitter Instagram linkedIn

Follow Zemach FM and give us comment

item.title: Companies And Implementations Worth Mentioning In Artificial Intelligence
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 42nd episode of Zemach Fm, we are discussing about some well-known companies and implementations that are doing and have done a huge impact on the growth of Artificial intelligence. We will talk about how those companies and implementations achieved that, how the services are provided, what kind of projects and implementations they are composed of, and many more.

Episode Timeline

02á¡30 Introduction to the episode title

03:10 What is the AI Effect

05:30 Baidu – A company from china with advanced Artificial intelligence implementations

12:40 Deepmind – The AI powerhouse of Google

12:50 Alphafold from Deepmind. Structuring human proteins.

14:00 Alphago beating Go champions

16:30 Wavenet – Sound synthesis AI implementation from Deepmind.

18:35 Open AI progressing machine learning models

40:13 Cimon the robot – helping astronauts in space.

42:12 WAYMO and self-driving cars

item.itunes:subtitle: On the 42nd tech this week episode we bring together some of the tech news that took place the previous week. The new Nothing earbud, Amazon’s 888 Million USD GDPR fine, Twitter’s AI bias bounty hunt, and Tesla’s recent accident at vict
item.itunes:summary:
On the 42nd tech this week episode we bring together some of the tech news that took place the previous week. The new Nothing earbud, Amazon’s 888 Million USD GDPR fine, Twitter’s AI bias bounty hunt, and Tesla’s recent accident at victoria are some of the news we talk about in this episode.
Episode Timeline
00:26 Twitter starts an Artificial intelligence bias bounty hunt with a payment of up to $3,500
02:23 Amazon fined 888 Million USD over GDPR violations
05:00 Telegram updated with a capacity of 1,000 video call members
08:00 A recently launched Russian spacecraft blames the software for thrust issues during the flight.
09:45 A Tesla megapack in victoria Austalia catches fire
11:15 The new Nothing company released their first product, Nothing Ear 1.
Contact the hosts

Abdulhadmid Oumer Twitter Instagram linkedIn

item.title: Github Co-Pilot: Stealing jobs or an honest pair programmer
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 41st episode of Zemach FM, we are discussing about Github Co-Pilot. Github copilot is a recently released AI-powered tool that assists developers and programmers in writing code efficiently. It suggests blocks of code to the programmer based on the function names, comments that the programmer writes as well as based on the context of previous code. We will be discussing what the tool is capable of, how it works as well as what Github has planned for the future of the tool.

Episode Timeline

02:00 Episode title introduction

05:45 Introduction to what Github Co-Pilot does

06:30 Who participated in building Github co-pilot

07:50 Additional remarks on what Github co-pilot is

10:30 Is co-pilot ready to replace developers?

11:30 Some nice side of Github copilot

13:00 How does Github co-pilot suggest codes

16:30 How are programmers taking their new co-pilot

17:20 Some flaws on the current Github co-pilot release

19:00 The issues with direct code snippet suggestions

20:40 Can training data licenses be a threat for the future of Github co-pilot

21:40 Is GitHub co-pilot a stochastic parrot

24:20 Can you fully trust the output from co-pilot

27:00 Is commercial software going to be the future for Github co-pilot

30:20 Does Github co-pilot leak secure keys from public codes?

Contact the hosts

Henok Tsegaye Twitter Instagram LinkedIn

Abdulhadmid Oumer Twitter Instagram linkedIn

Follow Zemach FM and give us comment

item.title: Episode 41: This Week In Tech (July 26, 2021)
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.itunes:subtitle: On the 41st news episode, we have compiled together some of the tech events that took place the previous week. We have included the recently released list that shows people affected by the pegasus spyware the list includes famous CEOs which include Whats
item.itunes:summary:
On the 41st news episode, we have compiled together some of the tech events that took place the previous week. We have included the recently released list that shows people affected by the pegasus spyware the list includes famous CEOs which include WhatsApp and Telegram CEOs, Jeff Bezos successfully completed his flight to space with his team, Kenya’s ride-hailing app Little planning to start its service in Ethiopia, Amazon looking for cryptocurrency experts and many more.
Episode Timeline
00:33 New website launched to help collect support for GERD with an international payment enabled.
02:30 Amazon recruiting cryptocurrency specialists
04:40 Kenyan ride-hailing app Little planning to start their service in Addis Ababa
08:00 Jeff Bezos successfully makes his trip to space with his team
10:40 NSO group’s Pegasus spyware attack list includes top tech CEOs which included the WhatsApp and Telegram CEO.
Contact the hosts
Henok Tsegaye Twitter Instagram LinkedIn
Abdulhadmid Oumer Twitter Instagram linkedIn

item.title: Neuralink: What it is and how it might change our world.
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 40th episode of Zemach FM, we are taking a look at Neuralink. A brain chip that aims to make direct communication from the human brain to digital devices and vice versa. With this breakthrough the company hopes to treat different brain-related illnesses as well as moving towards complicated operations like telepathic communication, memory storing and recovery, as well as many other operations in the future. We discussed how the company and the idea got to this stage, how the device works, its current state, and what it might hold in the future.

Episode Timeline

02:00 Episode title introduction

03:30 A little about pager the monkey

04:10 How Neuralink got started

07:26 Some similar implementations of neuralink and inspirations for the device.

10:00 How neuralink progressed over time

12:00 How neuralink works

16:00 Some goals of the device

17:45 What is transhumanism ?

21:00 What can come after the write operation from neuralink

23:20 Hardware of the neural link

25:00 How the implantation process works

28:00 Where does neuralink use artificial intelligence

31:15 what the future of neuralink might bring

34:20 Some fallbacks of the technology

39:18 Our opinions about the tech

44:18 can it be accepted in to different communities?

Contact the hosts

Henok Tsegaye Twitter Instagram LinkedIn

Abdulhadmid Oumer Twitter Instagram linkedIn

Follow Zemach FM and give us comment

item.title: Episode 40: This Week In Tech (July 19, 2021)
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.itunes:subtitle: On the 40th tech this week episode, we combine and bring you some of the tech news that took place the previous week of July 19, 2021. We have highlighted how Xiaomi is not the second market shareholder beating Apple, WhatsApp making multiple device sign
item.itunes:summary:
On the 40th tech this week episode, we combine and bring you some of the tech news that took place the previous week of July 19, 2021. We have highlighted how Xiaomi is not the second market shareholder beating Apple, WhatsApp making multiple device sign-in possible using the cloud, How Facebook pay is moving to multiple platforms, and the new Microsoft 365 cloud service.
Episode Timeline
00:20 WhatsApp to store encrypted messages on the cloud, which in return will let users to log in and use the service from any device.
02:25 Xiaomi now holds second place in the global smartphone market share, taking the position away from Apple.
05:10 Microsoft starts a new 365 subscription service, that will let users access their files as well as the whole settings and applications anywhere while logging in.
06:50 Facebook to start implementing Facebook pay on other platforms starting this August.
Contact the hosts
Henok Tsegaye Twitter Instagram LinkedIn
Abdulhadmid Oumer Twitter Instagram linkedIn

item.title: Software development in Ethiopia: Our opinions
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 39th episode of Zemach FM, we took a break from our Artificial Intelligence series and had a general discussion about Software development in Ethiopia. We discussed our opinions on the things that are getting implemented in a good manner, where we need to improve more on, how we can improve on those parts of software implementations, and the overall software development culture in Ethiopia.

Episode Timeline

02:50 Episode title introduction

05:15 Some of the apps we usually use.

10:00 Some disturbing user experiences

13:00 Reaching the main goal of the Application

14:15 The importance of continuous development

17:30 Better user interfaces.

22:00 Makings Systems and applications scalable – the famous á²áµá°á á¨áá

26:28 Optimizing your code

27:30 How the closed-door policy is hurting us

item.title: Will Artificial Intelligence Take Over: An Artificial Intelligence Series | Part 09
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 38th episode of Zemach FM, we are trying to discuss if Artificial intelligence is really capable of taking over the world. We tried to see the different opinions that experts have regarding this topic and also what our opinion about the topic is. As the future of artificial intelligence is pretty hard to predict, most of the discussions we have on this episode are personal opinions.

Episode Timeline

04:30 Episode title introduction

07:40 What the current advancement of technology tells us

10:20 Does the current implementations of AI imply that we are going to be overtaken by machines

13:30 How quantum physics help us in predicting the future of AI

18:40 The behavior of the universe in relation to the future of AI

21:42 Can Quantum computing provide us with a more performant Artificial intelligence model

24:04 Our opinions in regard to the topic

25:00 The talk between Jack Ma and Elon Musk

26:30 Are we in the progress of losing to machines

30:05 What different experts think about this topic

33:10 The different theories of how AI could take over.

38:10 General artificial intelligence

40:00 The matrix movie and Neuralink, uploading knowledge to your brain.

Contact the hosts

item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 35th main episode of Zemach Fm, we are talking what some of the challenges that people face while working with artificial intelligence systems as well as what the disadvantage of artificial intelligence is. We will be discussing some of the well-known points when it comes to this topic, some of which are unemployment, bias, lack of human emotion, computing power, and many more.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence In Our Day To Day Lives: An Artificial Intelligence Series | Part 4
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 33rd episode of Zemach Fm, we will be taking a look at how artificial intelligence is affecting our day-to-day lives. We will mainly be viewing Apps and Softwares we use daily and how they utilize the power of Artificial intelligence to satisfy their customers. Starting with personal assistants we will make our way to social media like Facebook, Instagram & Tik Tok next we will be taking a look at how Google as a company is using AI in their different products finally we will look at streaming services like YouTube and Netflix.

item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On our 32nd Zemach FM and third episode of the artificial intelligence series, we are discussing about natural language processing. Natural language processing is getting more involved in our day-to-day lives directly or indirectly. We will be discussing what natural language processing is, how it works, how natural language processing got to its current state, the different challenges in the field, and what the future of natural language processing might look like.

item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 30th episode of ZemachFM we are taking starting the artificial intelligence series. On this episode, we are discussing an introduction to what exactly artificial intelligence is, the history of how it came into existence, the current implementations, where it is being used widely, and what the future of artificial intelligence might look like. This is an introduction episode to the topic and there will be much more episodes related to artificial intelligence coming in the following weeks.

In today’s last episode of the security series, we are discussing how you can prevent security threats from happening to you locally on your computer to threats happening over the internet. We also discussed how you can make your online activity as private as possible. We will give you tips, mechanisms, and resources as to how you can achieve those things.

On the 26th episode of zemach fm, we are discussing about operating system security. This one of the episodes in our on going cyber-security series. On our operating system security episode we talked about the different kind of vulnerabilities and threats that the most popular operating system i.e Windows, MacOs and Linux have. Why windows is more exposed to malware as compared to the other two and what we can do to prevent most of the threats out there.

05:20 How the design of the operating system cause problems later on
07:10 Why windows is more affected by malwares
08:40 Previous version of windows and how they were flawed
15:14 Attacks and vulnerabilities on Linux OS
18:00 Privileges on Linux OS
19:43 Global or all OS security threats
20:20 Some security issue prevention methods

item.title: Internet security: A cybersecurity series
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 25 the episode of Zemach FM we are continuing on the cybersecurity series. In this episode, we are discussing about some of the main threats and vulnerabilities on the internet. The main titles discussed on this episode include cookie vulnerabilities and threats, Denial of service attacks, Web app vulnerabilities, and social engineering. We discuss what methods are used by attackers to perform them, to what extent it could affect a service, and some of the measures that can be taken to prevent or stop the attacks listed above.

Episode Timeline

01:30 Title introduction

04:30 Vulnerabilities and threats caused by cookies

05:40 What exactly is cookie used for

07:13 How cross site request forgery (CSRF) works

10:53 What is a Cross site scripting (XSS) attack

12:03 The three different types of XSS attacks

15:00 XSS attack prevention methods

18:07 What is a denial of service attack

20:18 What is the difference between distributed and non-distributed denial of service attack

21:36 How a distributed denial of service works

23:53 Common types of denial of service attacks

28:54 Ways of preventing and stopping a denial of service attack

33:53 SQL injection what it is and how it works

37:00 Ways of preventing an SQL injection

38:03 Click jacking attacks

40:02 Social engineering attacks

42:57 What is a phishing attack

43:30 Examples of a phishing attack

46:30 Social engineering and scams in our country

53:10 Closing talk

Contact the hosts

Henok Tsegaye Twitter Instagram LinkedIn

Abdulhadmid Oumer Twitter Instagram linkedIn

item.itunes:summary:
On the 23rd episode of Zemach Fm we are discussing about internet of things, the new trend that’s affecting people’s day-to-day life and also is predicted to influence more people in the coming years. We have discussed what exactly an IoT is, the first implementation of IoT, what factors made IoT a reality, some of the use cases it has, the different components it has, and many more concepts of IoT.

item.itunes:summary:
On the 22nd episode of Zemach FM, we are taking a look at the open-source world. Open source plays a huge part in our life whether we are technical people or normal users of the digital world. In this episode we start by defining the concept of open source, how it got to where it is now through time, the different licenses that open source software use, and finally the pros & cons of making software open source.

item.title: The Apple INC. Profile
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 21st episode of Zemach FM we are taking a look at Apple INC.’s company profile. We will be discussing the history of Apple, how Apple was founded by the three original founders Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak & Ron Wayne and what products Apple was shipping during different period of times. Apple is currently the most valuable company in the world with a total of 2.12 Trillion USD value. They have doubled this price within 2 years since 2018, while the company was the first to reach a trillion-dollar valuation in history.

Episode Timeline

01:00 Title introduction

item.itunes:summary:
On the 20th episode of Zemach Fm, we are discussing about rovers and their exploration of different parts of space. We tried to see the historical chronology until the most recent perseverance rover, their specifications limitations, what they have achieved in their lifetime, and much more. Most of our discussion will be focused more on rovers that were sent to Mars.

item.title: Inspiring children to code: With Nathan Damtew
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 19th episode of Zemach FM, Nathan Damtew was our guest. Nathan is the founder and CEO at BeBlocky, an AR(Augmented Reality) mobile game that lets children learn the basics of programming like conditions in a fun and interactive way. Nathan is also a managerial director at Yenetta code which is a coding education center mostly focused on children. On this episode we took a look at how he started these two companies, how they are helping children to understand the basics of programming without making it a hustle.

Episode Timeline

01:00 Introducing Nathan to the show

02:30 How Nathan Damtew got into tech and entrepreneurship

item.title: The Mobile Phone: How it started, How it is going
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 18th episode of ZemachFm, we discussed about mobile phones. The topic is wide but we tried to take a look at how the mobile phone evolved over time, from the first mobile phone Motorolla Dynatac to the era of the smartphone. We saw how companies and individuals managed to bring game-changing functionalities into their mobile phones. We also mentioned how the first concept and implementation of a smartphone was done in 1992 by IBM. Listen to this episode to hear more about the topics mentioned above as well as some of the events that happened in tech this week.

item.title: Social media from the east: TikTok and WeChat
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
On the 17th episode of ZemachFM, we are discussing about social media companies that are coming from the eastern part of our world rather than the west. TikTok and WeChat will be our main focus in this episode. Both are social medias that spawned out of china. They also have made a significant impact on the rest of the world, specially TikTok is becoming one of the mainstream social media out there with over 800 Million active users globally (Datareportal, 2020). This and more points will be discussed on today’s episode, have a nice week !!

Episode Timeline

02:20 Reminder on what we discussed last time

03:00 This episodes discussion highlights

05:20 Introduction to WeChat and the how it’s operating in the Chinese market

06:27 Which category does WeChat belong too ?

07:00 Features of WeChat

09:00 Concept of mini programs on WeChat

12:35 Why is WeChat successful in china

item.title: Signal VS Telegram: Migrating From WhatsApp
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.itunes:subtitle: Due to the recent WhatsApp Policy changes many users are flocking to other instant messaging platforms mainly Signal & WhatsApp. On this episode of ZemachFM we compared two of the up and coming chat platforms. We tried to divide their pros and cons
item.itunes:summary:
Due to the recent WhatsApp Policy changes many users are flocking to other instant messaging platforms mainly Signal & WhatsApp. On this episode of ZemachFM we compared two of the up and coming chat platforms. We tried to divide their pros and cons in two basic sections, their features and how they enforce their security measures. Take a listen and choose your platform or use both, we hope our points will help with your decision.
Episode Timeline
01:35 Why are people ditching WhatsApp
02:45 Which alternatives are people choosing
04:11 Why is telegram more popular in Ethiopia
04:50 Comparing signal and telegram based on their security features

15:20 Comparing the two based on their features
27:50 Using unofficial Telegram clients
28:55 Our choices from the two

item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
Episode Content

On this episode of ZemachFm we took a look at cloud computing. What exactly is cloud computing, what are the different characteristics of cloud computing, what are the different service models of cloud computing, and what are the pros & cons of this technology were among the points we discussed. And as always we took a look at some events that took place in the tech world the previous week.

item.title: Being a Developer and digitizing eQub with Yohana Ermias.
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
In this episode of Zemach FM podcast, we have talked with CTO and co-founder at eQub , Yohana Ermias. In our discussion, we talked about being a developer and being a self-taught developer. we also talked about their brand new app on a test phase called eQub.

self taught programmer paths on github

  • https://github.com/ossu/computer-science
  • https://github.com/Nerajno/Front-End-Web-Developer-Path

link to Yohana

  • instagram

More about eQub

  • webiste
  • facebook twitter instagram

Episode content

  • 02:25 Tech giants role in the chaos that happened in America
  • 04:17 So why donât you tell us a bit about yourself?
  • 11:53 You started programming with IOS(Swift), What do you think about the stereotype that IOS âdevelopment is hardâ
  • 16:13 In your previous interview with Afro FM. You have said you were not able to scale because you didnât learn computer science theories, so how do you put the importance of computer science theories and how did you overcome them?
  • 20:30 What are you working on right now and if you are planning on doing a tutorial,
  • 21:57 I would be great to get your opinion on frameworks like flutter
  • 23:00 What is your work habit like and how did you develop good work ethics?
  • 27:10 How do you handle burnouts?
  • 29:10 What is your opinion about outsourcing software solutions?
  •  32:18 What is the most common mistake self-taught programmers make
  • 36:30 Previous projects by Yohana Ermias
  • 42:30 Have you ever felt imposter syndrome? If so how did you handle it
  • 44:47 Moving on to your most recent activities we find the eQub App, so what exactly does your app do, what does it solve? How does it work?
  • 46:50 How does an eQub group work on your app? Is it like auto-generated via the app, do you search and join one, do users find contacts from their phone and try to make a group?
  • 49:27 It would be great if you tell us how this idea appeared to you guys, was there a special eureka moment?
  • 51:07 We are really curious about how you guys are planning to manage the payment issues in our country?
  • 53:03 How did the first beta test go for eQub?
  • 54:11 So what was the hardest part about developing a system like this in Ethiopia? it might be related to bureaucracy or lack of developers or any other thing
  • 55:20 Any last advice for developers specially for self-thought developers?
  • 56:57 Any last words you want to pass to our listeners

This week in Tech

  • Whatsapp and Facebook to share users data outside EU and UK
  • Elon Musk becomes the richest man on earth
  • Adobe Flash Player comes to an End.
  • Parler got blocked from play store
  • Donald trump account suspended forever on Twitter and got suspended on Facebook, Shopify, and other main social platforms

You have said you were not able to scale because you didnât learn computer science theories, so how do you put the importance of computer science theories and how did you overcome them?20:30 What are you working on right now and if you are planning on doing a tutorial,21:57 I would be great to get your opinion on frameworks like flutter23:00 What is your work habit like and how did you develop good work ethics?27:10 How do you handle burnouts?29:10 What is your opinion about outsourcing software solutions? 32:18 What is the most common mistake self-taught programmers make36:30 Previous projects by Yohana Ermias42:30 Have you ever felt imposter syndrome? If so how did you handle it44:47 Moving on to your most recent activities we find the eQub App, so what exactly does your app do, what does it solve? How does it work?46:50 How does an eQub group work on your app? Is it like auto-generated via the app, do you search and join one, do users find contacts from their phone and try to make a group?49:27 It would be great if you tell us how this idea appeared to you guys, was there a special eureka moment?51:07 We are really curious about how you guys are planning to manage the payment issues in our country?53:03 How did the first beta test go for eQub?54:11 So what was the hardest part about developing a system like this in Ethiopia? it might be related to bureaucracy or lack of developers or any other thing55:20 Any last advice for developers specially for self-thought developers?56:57 Any last words you want to pass to our listeners

item.title: How and why software became mainstream
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
Contents of this episode

On this episode of Zemach FM we discuss how and why software became mainstream in our day o day life. we also tried to see how the software development and distribution evolved over time starting from punch cards to the internet and app stores era.

á á áá á¨ááá½ ááµá«áµáµ á­áá áá­ á¶ááµáá­ (software) á¥áá´áµ á¨áááµ á¨áááµ áá ááááá«á½á ááá á áá°á»á ááá¨áµ áá­á¨ááá¢ á¨áá á á°á¨ááª á¶ááµáá­ á¨ááá½ á«á­áµ á áá áá³ááá áµ á¨á¢áá°á­ááµ á á á á áµá¶á­ á¥áµá á áá°áá£ á°áá«á­á°áá á¢

Timeline For The Episode

02:00 A bit about giveaways in the holiday season.

05:10 Our thoughts on why software is mainstream this days.

08:05 Comparing the software industry with the hardware industry.

14:40 Can 3D printing reduce the pain for the hardware industry.

16:30 How software distribution evolved over time.

20:37 Apollo mission’s contribution to the software industry.

32:30 This week in tech

32:50 Telegram’s new group audio chat feature

38:06 Telegram to implement Ads starting 2021

41:55 Elon musk’s attempt to sell Tesla for apple back in 2017

44:33 Tesla, Space – X, Boring Company and Neuralink allegedly to come under a parent company called Company X

46:50 The state of California granting license for autonomous cars to deliver items to customers starting next year.

49:56 Closing section

item.title: The Operating System Battle
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
Contents of this episode

On this episode of ZemachFm we tried to discuss about different PC operating systems. Mainly Windows, MacOS and Linux. We discussed the best and worst part of the operating systems listed above.

Timeline For The Episode

02:40 A bit of introduction about the operating system battle

08:50 Introduction on Linux and Unix

15:10 The first versions of the Windows operating system

17:10 The idea for GUI and the Mouse

22:10 Different good and bad features implemented by Windows, macOS, and Linux.

30:15 More about Linux

41:00 This week in tech,

42:15 The recent Best African App for Qene game’s Gebeta

44:35 Netflix testing audio-only mode

48:23 Zoox, launching autonomous ride-sharing vehicles.

51:00 More about the recent windows operating system

57:30 macOS Versions

1:00:00 The Linux community

1:10:20 Windows and the virus hell

item.title: Tech and AI with Betelhem Dessie
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
The main content of our Interview With Betelhem Dessie

á¨á¤á´ááá á°á´ áá­ á«á°á¨ááá áá ááááµ áá á­ááµ

In this episode of our podcast, we will discuss general tech and AI with Betelhem Dessie. Betelhem Dessie is the Chief Advisor at Icog, a founder at Icog-ACC ( anyone can code ), and a partner with kudu ventures.

In this episode, we have covered

  • Interview with Betelhem Dessie
    • 2:34 What are you most focused on
    • 3:16 Are most of your promising candidates (Solve-it or I-Cog ACC) from the rural part of Ethiopia or from Addis Ababa?
    • 4:49 Can you tell us a bit about the work you did for Hersheyâs chocolate and Sophia? With the Sophia project we would be happy to hear the technical part, like was i-cog involved in the NLP or image recognition or even emotion detection?
    • 7:52 Do you get any ML projects from Ethiopian companies?  How do you see the AI, in Ethiopia and the world
    • 9:58 Do you think AI will take over if so how
    • 13:15 AI and stereotype, do you think itâs because of the training data or the people that actually code it?
    • 14:48 Is tech talent or skill,  what is your favorite programming language
    • 16:49At the end of your interview with Mella, you advised people to find their mentor, who was your mentor, or someone who had a big impact on your professional life.
    • 17:41 Do you ever feel imposter syndrome?
    • 18:14 In an interview with CGTN you said we donât want tech colonization, how tech colonized do you think we are currently in Ethiopia? With the way, we use social media for example.
    • 20:43 What kind of results are you getting from projects like girls can code and solve-it? is it as you expected it when you started?
    • 24:04 What are the potentials and some mistakes you see in people who are starting to code?
    • 25:43 Why are we copy cat from western rather than creating a solution that fits our culture
    • 27:53 Any advice for people who are starting to get into tech and also to our podcast?
  • This week in Tech
    • 30:47 Dr. Timnit Gebru got fired from Google, She is one of the senior Black people in AI participating in Tech.
    • 35:22 Tik Tok is testing the video length from 1 minute to 3 minutes
    • 37:57 Slack is getting acquired by the salesforce for 27 billion dollar
    • 41:36 Spotify got hacked on this week, it was not serious but it left some people mad.

item.title: What does it take to be a developer? and how do you keep up with the tech as a developer?
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
Content of this episode ( zemach FM season 1 episode 6, what does it take to be a developer) content.

In this podcast, we will discuss becoming a true developer and what it takes to become one. In this discussion, we will bring some key points we think are important to be a good developer. Also as usual we will take a look at this week in tech. After that part, we will discuss keeping up with the technology as a developer. As a developer, we don’t want to outdate ourself as the environment for development is always changing. So in this part, we will suggest ways to keep up with the technology environment.

What does it take to be a developer episode contents.

  • 2:52 Mistakes we made through our podcast, we try to correct them here
  • 5:06 What does it take to be a developer? In this section, we define what a developer role should be and we take a deep dive into how to achieve those qualities. In this part, we mainly talked about personal qualities needed to achieve as a developer, as we believe being a developer needs skill rather than talent.
  • 39:58 This week in tech
    • Ethiopian communication authority has announced it is ready to give license to 2 telecommunication companies
    • Twitter has announced Fleet, Twitter has twitted on Twitter “That thing you didnât Tweet but wanted to but didnât but got so close but then were like nah.We have a place for that nowâFleets! Rolling out to everyone starting today.” check it here
    • Israel scientists said they have successfully reversed the human aging process for the first time
    • Apple’s M1 chip has been landed on people’s hands and what are people thinking about it?
  • How to keep up with the technology as a developer. In this section, we discuss some of the keys tools and ways that you can keep up with the ever-changing tech environment. in our discussion we considered our situation as a developer and techy in Ethiopia, and we try to express our tools and ways considering that.

you might also be interested in Do we need more developers in Ethiopia? And do you have to get a degree to become one?

item.content:encoded:
Content of this episode ( zemach FM season 1 episode 6, what does it take to be a developer) content.

In this podcast, we will discuss becoming a true developer and what it takes to become one. In this discussion, we will bring some key points we think are important to be a good developer. Also as usual we will take a look at this week in tech. After that part, we will discuss keeping up with the technology as a developer. As a developer, we don’t want to outdate ourself as the environment for development is always changing. So in this part, we will suggest ways to keep up with the technology environment.

What does it take to be a developer episode contents.

  • 2:52 Mistakes we made through our podcast, we try to correct them here
  • 5:06 What does it take to be a developer? In this section, we define what a developer role should be and we take a deep dive into how to achieve those qualities. In this part, we mainly talked about personal qualities needed to achieve as a developer, as we believe being a developer needs skill rather than talent.
  • 39:58 This week in tech
    • Ethiopian communication authority has announced it is ready to give license to 2 telecommunication companies
    • Twitter has announced Fleet, Twitter has twitted on Twitter “That thing you didnât Tweet but wanted to but didnât but got so close but then were like nah.We have a place for that nowâFleets! Rolling out to everyone starting today.” check it here
    • Israel scientists said they have successfully reversed the human aging process for the first time
    • Apple’s M1 chip has been landed on people’s hands and what are people thinking about it?
  • How to keep up with the technology as a developer. In this section, we discuss some of the keys tools and ways that you can keep up with the ever-changing tech environment. in our discussion we considered our situation as a developer and techy in Ethiopia, and we try to express our tools and ways considering that.

you might also be interested in Do we need more developers in Ethiopia? And do you have to get a degree to become one?

item.title: Do we need more developers in Ethiopia? And do you have to get a degree to become one?
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
In this episode of zemach FM, we will discuss Developers and tech in Ethiopia. and we will ask questions like do we need more people in it and what does it take to be a developer. also, we will go through Do you need a college diploma or a degree to be a developer can you learn it all by your self? and try to reason out which way might be more appropriate in our country.

Outline for this episode ( Do we need more developers in Ethiopia )

This topic might be a little bit huge to talk about but we have narrow to our country and try to answer the question based on reason and our private experiences. Developers in Ethiopia might be interested to comment on our podcast and let us know how they view our reasons.

  • 1:34 we will outline what we will discuss about
  • 3:29 Do we need more software developers in Ethiopia? in this section we will discuss in-depth why we need more developers and more people getting involved in Tech. We will look at the main reasons why we concluded we need more developers and peoples in Tech.
  • 22:24 This week in Tech. in this section we will look at four main news in the technology world
    • Raspberry PI 400
    • Robo cab ( Robo taxi )
    • Airbnb IPO
    • Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and Mark Zuckerberg admits Social media can be addictive
    • “Tesquila” rolls worldwide
    • Youtube new payment policy and Ad
  • 48:24 Do you need a college degree to be a developer? In this section, we will discuss the main reasons why you might need a degree and how you can be a software engineer without a degree. we will discuss the pros and cons of both approaches and try to reason out which one you should go with. Besides those reasons above we will ask what it will be for Ethiopia and how it can be different for other countries.

In this episode of zemach FM, we will discuss Developers and tech in Ethiopia. and we will ask questions like do we need more people in it and what does it take to be a developer. also, we will go through Do you need a college diploma or a degree to be a developer can you learn it all by your self? and try to reason out which way might be more appropriate in our country.

Outline for this episode ( Do we need more developers in Ethiopia )

This topic might be a little bit huge to talk about but we have narrow to our country and try to answer the question based on reason and our private experiences. Developers in Ethiopia might be interested to comment on our podcast and let us know how they view our reasons.

item.itunes:summary:
Do we need more developers in Ethiopia? And do you have to get a degree to become one?
In this episode of zemach FM, we will discuss Developers and tech in Ethiopia. and we will ask questions like do we need more people in it and what does it take to be a developer. also, we will go through Do you need a college diploma or a degree to be a developer can you learn it all by your self? and try to reason out which way might be more appropriate in our country.
Outline for this episode ( Do we need more developers in Ethiopia )
This topic might be a little bit huge to talk about but we have narrow to our country and try to answer the question based on reason and our private experiences. Developers in Ethiopia might be interested to comment on our podcast and let us know how they view our reasons.
1:34 we will outline what we will discuss about3:29 Do we need more software developers in Ethiopia? in this section we will discuss in-depth why we need more developers and more people getting involved in Tech. We will look at the main reasons why we concluded we need more developers and peoples in Tech.22:24 This week in Tech. in this section we will look at four main news in the technology worldRaspberry PI 400Robo cab ( Robo taxi )Airbnb IPOTwitter CEO Jack Dorsey and Mark Zuckerberg admits Social media can be addictive“Tesquila” rolls worldwideYoutube new payment policy and Ad
48:24 Do you need a college degree to be a developer? In this section, we will discuss the main reasons why you might need a degree and how you can be a software engineer without a degree. we will discuss the pros and cons of both approaches and try to reason out which one you should go with. Besides those reasons above we will ask what it will be for Ethiopia and how it can be different for other countries.

item.itunes:author: Zemach FM

item.title: Silicon Valley: The cradle of innovation.
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
Silicon Valley, The tech world competing with silicon valley and tech in Ethiopia.

In this podcast, we talk about How Silicon valley has started and the tech ecosystem in that region. Besides that, we will talk about other tech areas that are booming and might be competing with Silicon Valley, and last but not least we will go through the tech environment in Ethiopia.

These are the outlines for out episode podcast

  • 4:16 History of Silicon valley deep Dive. In this section, we will explore the history of silicon valley from the start and how it came to be one of the biggest tech hubs in the world. What series of Events happened there? Who played a major role would be discussed.
  • 27:11 This week in Tech. In this section, we will discuss UWB ( Ultra Wide Band ) and the “one more thing” Event of apple. We will take a deep dive into the event and what it brought.
  • 41:43 We talked about other emerging tech regions in the world. In this section of our talk, we will briefly discuss why we choose those places and why startups are joining that area.
  • 57:07 The tech environment in Ethiopia. How is the startup in Ethiopia? How is it improving and how it might be improved!

item.content:encoded:
Silicon Valley, The tech world competing with silicon valley and tech in Ethiopia.

In this podcast, we talk about How Silicon valley has started and the tech ecosystem in that region. Besides that, we will talk about other tech areas that are booming and might be competing with Silicon Valley, and last but not least we will go through the tech environment in Ethiopia.

These are the outlines for out episode podcast

  • 4:16 History of Silicon valley deep Dive. In this section, we will explore the history of silicon valley from the start and how it came to be one of the biggest tech hubs in the world. What series of Events happened there? Who played a major role would be discussed.
  • 27:11 This week in Tech. In this section, we will discuss UWB ( Ultra Wide Band ) and the “one more thing” Event of apple. We will take a deep dive into the event and what it brought.
  • 41:43 We talked about other emerging tech regions in the world. In this section of our talk, we will briefly discuss why we choose those places and why startups are joining that area.
  • 57:07 The tech environment in Ethiopia. How is the startup in Ethiopia? How is it improving and how it might be improved!

item.itunes:author: Zemach FM

item.title: Covid-19 and Technology, how it affected our life part 2 (final)
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
In this podcast, we will talk about Covid-19 and its effect on our life but especially on Technology. This part will concentrate on situations that exist in Ethiopia and the factors that affect those. We will talk about contact tracing, ITM (interactive tailer Machine ), Testing, and Taxi-hailing applications.

What This Part Will Talk About

  • 1:05 Contact tracing Technology and the Dream collaboration between apple and google, how it works and how are things now. is it efficient for now
  • 10:30 ITM What is ITM ? what does it bring to the Table in the Banking Sector and other explanations
  • 16:37 Testing in Ethiopia. How is our capability increasing and why are there fewer people getting tested nowadays?
  • 21:50 Taxi Hailing Applications and how did they survive in Covid-19 time. What were the frauds that everyone was talking about?

see you in next one

item.title: Covid-19 and Technology, how it affected our life part 1
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
Covid-19 and Technology, how it affected our life part 1

In this episode of zemach FM, we will be talking about Covid-19 and the effect it has on our lives and technology in general. This is part one of our discussion we will talk more in Detail about Technology changed in our next podcast but for this one, we have covered how working from home has been, how the conferences were and Our Internet and how Tik Tok is becoming the trend.

This episode Podcast Topics

1:00 We acknowledge our countries situation and hopes everything would be better

3:37 Working from home. What companies are making this move and how this is working out in Ethiopia.

10:33 Working from home and ZOOM, why did zoom boom? We will take a look at statistics showing zoom is booming and why that happened

22:02 Internet in the time of corona, people were using the Internet more than ever in these times. We will talk about What caused and how it changed the way we use technology.

28:00 Tik tok and Corona. Major spike for tik tok in the time of corona , what caused it? and Who is using tik tok now

34:17 This week in tech we will go through

  • Tik Tok and shopify
  • Star link
  • Neuralink
  • Telegram new features
  • Instagram and Messenger integration

item.title: Zemach FM Podcast. Introduction, Season 1 Episode 1
item.dc:creator: Zemach FM
item.description:
Contents of the Episode, First Episode of Zemach FM Podcast

In this episode, we will introduce zemach FM podcast. Zemach Fm will talk about tech in general. When discussing this topic we will cover past and present events. We will talk about tech in history and how that influences the world right now. The other main thing would be how tech will evolve in the future.

In this episode, we also talked about new tech that been released about a month ago. we covered iPhone 12.

item.content:encoded:
Contents of the Episode, First Episode of Zemach FM Podcast

In this episode, we will introduce zemach FM podcast. Zemach Fm will talk about tech in general. When discussing this topic we will cover past and present events. We will talk about tech in history and how that influences the world right now. The other main thing would be how tech will evolve in the future.

In this episode, we also talked about new tech that been released about a month ago. we covered iPhone 12.
